page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: The greater part of the housing, particularly in Askam, is terraced and up to 100 years old. Much of the housing was of low standard but recently has been modernised up to an expected degree. Much of the surrounding wasteland left after the rundown of the Askam Iron Works has been cleared and is providing reasonable development areas. The coastal areas provide facilities for water sports and other relaxations, notwithstanding the problem of some unmade roads and marshy land, access is quite reasonable. A general view of the area from coastal vantage points is enhanced by the rising fells of the Lake District National Park.
